title: MMA fighter Loik Radzhabov spat on by cornerman between rounds at PFL 8
text:
Radzhabov’s corner had unusual methods (Picture: PFL)

You think you’ve seen everything in MMA and then a coach spits on his fighter between rounds to cool him off.

But that’s exactly what happened last Thursday at PFL 8 in Las Vegas during Loik Radzhabov’s play-off clash with Chris Wade.

The entertaining fight ended in an unanimous decision for Radzhabov who had earlier in the night drawn against Islam Mamedov.

But it was in between rounds where the strangest action took place as Radzhabov’s team attempted to keep their fighter cool during a busy night of fights.

The scientifically proven most effective way of cooling off your fighter in between rounds. #PFLPlayoffs pic.twitter.com/xBNEOwkvcz — MacMally🍀 (@MacMallyMMA) October 18, 2019

A cornerman took a gulp of water before bizarrely spitting it all over Radzhabov. We’ve seen Nathaniel Wood get slapped by his coach Brad Pickett before fights, but nothing quite so strange as being deliberately spat on by your team.

In the end it was a good night for Radzhabov as he beat Wade in his second fight to progress to the lightweight finals.

Radzhabov will take on Natan Schulte in 31 December in New York in the final with a $1million prize on the line.
